repositories.brief_summary: String module additions and DragonFly BSD native backend support merged
repositories.new_features_summary: String.of_char, String.is_empty functions added; DragonFly BSD native compilation enabled
repositories.new_features:
- **String.of_char** function converts a single character to a string, providing clearer intent than `String.make 1 c` ([#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14440))
- **String.is_empty** predicate checks if a string is empty ([#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14438))
- **DragonFly BSD native backend** enabled, making `ocamlopt` available on DragonFly BSD x86_64 systems (added to Tier 2 platform support) ([#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14431))
- **Testsuite enhancement** with new `not-root` builtin action allowing tests to be skipped when running as superuser ([#14435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14435))
repositories.activity_summary: Seven new PRs opened for stdlib enhancements; String module expansion continues with search, replace, and split functions
repositories.activity:
- Seven **new PRs opened** this week including [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)'s String module enhancements with search primitives ([#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381)), substring replacement functions ([#14436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14436)), split functions ([#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14437)), and `String.includes` for affix checking ([#14439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14439)); [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adding bit counting functions ([#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433)) and division operations ([#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14432)); and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) improving testsuite resilience ([#14441](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14441))
- **String module expansion** continues with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) proposing comprehensive string processing capabilities in [#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137), including `find_{first,last}` and `find_all` for substring searching ([#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381)), `replace_{first,last,all}` for substring replacement ([#14436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14436)), and `split_{first,last,all}` for breaking strings with separators ([#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14437))
- **Bit manipulation functions** proposed by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adding `popcount`, `nlz`, `ntz`, `nls`, and related bit counting functions to Int, Int32, Int64, and Nativeint modules using pure OCaml implementations based on Hacker's Delight algorithms ([#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433))
- **Integer division operations** introduced by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) with `fdiv` (floor division), `cdiv` (ceil division), `ediv` (Euclidean division), and `emod` (Euclidean remainder) providing non-negative remainders suitable for modulo arithmetic ([#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14432))
- **Unstable feature annotation** mechanism proposed by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) with `[@@unstable]` attributes allowing experimental APIs to be marked and gated behind `-Z` flags or local `[@@@unstable_feature]` attributes ([#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14430))
- **Platform support** work continues with [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) activating native backend for Haiku OS ([#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138))
- **Option.value_or** PR by [@hirrolot](https://github.com/hirrolot) remains under committee discussion with concerns about naming and API design ([#13937](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13937))
- **Format_string module** proposal by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) introducing dedicated module for format string functions to reduce stdlib dependency on CamlinternalFormat ([#12670](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12670))
repositories.discussions_summary: String module improvements discussed with focus on naming consistency and API completeness
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **String module API design** extensively discussed in [#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137) with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) proposing naming conventions using `first`, `last`, and `all` keywords for search-based operations, balancing readability with consistency across `find`, `replace`, and `split` functions
- **Unstable features mechanism** debated in [#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14430) with [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) arguing for Rust-style unstable attributes to enable faster stdlib evolution, while [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) expressing concerns about ecosystem fragmentation and design responsibility
- **Polymorphic parameters soundness** discussed in [#14434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14434) where [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) reported segfault with pattern matching on polymorphic parameters, with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) identifying exhaustiveness checking failure in `Parmatch`
repositories.trends_summary: String module receiving focused enhancements; stdlib evolution process under active discussion
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **String module modernization** gaining momentum with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) systematically adding search, replace, and split functions ([#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381), [#14436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14436), [#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14437), [#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14438), [#14439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14439), [#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14440)) addressing long-standing gaps in string processing capabilities
- **Stdlib API expansion** continuing with mathematical functions by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adding bit manipulation ([#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433)) and division operations ([#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14432)) that match capabilities found in libraries like Zarith
- **Stdlib evolution process** under examination with proposals for unstable features ([#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14430)) and Format_string module ([#12670](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12670)) reflecting broader discussion about balancing stability with faster feature delivery
- **Platform support expansion** with DragonFly BSD and Haiku OS native backends being enabled ([#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14431), [#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138))
repositories.contributors_summary: Daniel Bünzli, Xavier Leroy, and core reviewers actively developing String and numeric stdlib enhancements
repositories.contributors:
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) implemented `String.of_char` ([#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14440)) and `String.is_empty` ([#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14438)) which merged this week, opened PRs for string search primitives ([#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381)), substring replacement ([#14436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14436)), string splitting ([#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14437)), and affix checking ([#14439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14439)), and led the String module improvement discussion ([#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137))
- [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) proposed adding bit counting functions including `popcount`, `nlz`, and `ntz` ([#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433)) and integer division operations with `fdiv`, `cdiv`, `ediv`, and `emod` ([#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14432))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) implemented the `not-root` testsuite action to skip tests when running as superuser ([#14435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14435)) and reviewed DragonFly BSD support ([#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14431))
- [Michael Neumann](https://github.com/mneumann) enabled native backend for DragonFly BSD ([#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14431))
- [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) proposed unstable feature annotations ([#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14430)), reported polymorphic parameters soundness bug ([#14434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14434)), and provided feedback on String module PRs
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) reviewed multiple PRs ([#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14438), [#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14440), [#14435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14435), [#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14431)), proposed testsuite improvements ([#14441](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14441)), and participated in soundness bug investigation ([#14434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14434))
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) provided extensive reviews on String module enhancements ([#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14438), [#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14440), [#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14437), [#14439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14439)) and division operations ([#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14432))
- [Simon Cruanes](https://github.com/c-cube) expressed support for bit counting functions ([#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433))
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) provided review feedback on String search primitives including Hacker's Delight reference updates ([#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381))
- [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) participated in unstable features discussion raising concerns about ecosystem dynamics ([#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14430))
- [@redianthus](https://github.com/redianthus) contributed to naming discussion for bit counting functions ([#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) discussed Option.value_or committee status ([#13937](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13937))

repositories.brief_summary: Format upgrade lock handling fix merged for Windows compatibility
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed lock acquisition bug preventing switch and repository format upgrades on Windows
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **format upgrade lock handling** on Windows by reusing already-created global lock file descriptor instead of reopening it, preventing lock acquisition failures during switch and repository format upgrades ([#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839))
- Added new `lock` field to `OpamStateTypes.global_state` API to expose the global lock (not config lock) for internal state management ([#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839))
repositories.activity_summary: Ongoing work on nushell support, source caching optimizations, and internal repository configuration format improvements
repositories.activity:
- **Nushell shell support** work in progress by [Benjamin Voisin](https://github.com/benjamin-voisin) to enable `opam env` command with nushell via JSON output format, addressing initial support request ([#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330), [#6649](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6649))
- **Source caching optimization** PR by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) to save disk space by only caching dev packages in internal sources directory, extracting regular packages directly from archive cache which also improves Windows performance ([#6440](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6440), [#4056](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4056), [#5448](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5448))
- **Internal repository configuration** format redesign by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) to improve `repos-config` syntax with labeled section fields instead of optional list elements, pending documentation updates and rebase ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393), [#6327](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6327))
- **Haiku package manager** integration improvements being drafted by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) to add missing references for better Haiku OS support ([#6641](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6641))
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion about timestamp preservation issue in opam 2.2+ affecting automake dependencies
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **File timestamp handling** regression in opam ≥ 2.2 discussed by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) where source files copied from extraction to build directory lose original timestamps, triggering unnecessary automake regeneration and exposing missing build dependencies ([#6693](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6693), caused by [#4823](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4823))
- **Source extraction caching** feature request by [Armaël Guéneau](https://github.com/Armael) proposing hash-based mapping to reuse already-extracted source directories and improve incrementality when restarting interrupted installations ([#4056](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4056))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on Windows compatibility improvements and disk space optimization for opam internal state
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Windows platform support** receiving continued attention with lock handling fixes for format upgrades ([#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839)) and proposed source caching changes that would improve extraction performance on Windows ([#6440](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6440))
- **Alternative shell environment** support expanding beyond traditional Unix shells with ongoing nushell integration work ([#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330), [#6649](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6649)) and Haiku-specific improvements ([#6641](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6641))
- **Disk space optimization** initiatives addressing storage efficiency through selective source caching for dev packages only rather than duplicating all installed package sources ([#6440](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6440), [#4056](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4056))
repositories.contributors_summary: R. Boujbel implemented format upgrade fix, Kate reviewed, and several contributors advanced ongoing PRs
repositories.contributors:
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) implemented the format upgrade lock handling fix for Windows ([#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839)) and continues work on repository configuration format redesign ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) reviewed and merged the format upgrade fix ([#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839)), continues developing source caching optimization ([#6440](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6440)), provided review feedback on repository config changes ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393)), and identified root cause of timestamp issue ([#6693](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6693))
- [Benjamin Voisin](https://github.com/benjamin-voisin) working on nushell support implementation ([#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330))
- [pk](https://github.com/turbofish-pk) reported nushell compatibility issue on Fedora 42 ([#6649](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6649))
- [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) reported file timestamp preservation regression affecting automake-based builds ([#6693](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6693))
- [Armaël Guéneau](https://github.com/Armael) provided insights on source extraction caching feature request ([#4056](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4056))
- [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) working on Haiku package manager integration improvements ([#6641](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6641))

repositories.brief_summary: Fix for -short-paths configuration handling in Merlin and dependency updates
repositories.new_features_summary: Corrected -short-paths configuration default for Merlin integration
repositories.new_features: - Fixed **-short-paths configuration** for Merlin by removing incorrect `real_paths = false` default, ensuring proper handling of OCaml flags without negated `-short-paths` ([#1579](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1579), [5556d18](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/5556d188fa2c9516a851cf5627c8cf2dc2182a42))
repositories.activity_summary: PR opened for Merlin short-paths fix and automated dependency updates
repositories.activity:
- [Gaëtan Gilbert](https://github.com/SkySkimmer) **opened PR** to fix `-short-paths` configuration for Merlin, addressing issue where the default incorrectly set `real_paths = false` and preventing proper configuration from OCaml flags ([#1579](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1579) fixing [#1395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1395))
- Automated **flake.lock updates** via GitHub Actions updated Merlin (2025-06-24 → 2025-12-20) and nixpkgs dependencies (2025-08-10 → 2025-12-26) ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1437))
- [@10takla](https://github.com/10takla) reported **OCaml version conflict** between ocamlformat-mlx (requires ocaml < "5.4") and ocaml-lsp-server (requires ocaml >= "5.4"), issue was closed ([#1578](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1578) related to [#1528](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1528))
repositories.contributors_summary: Gaëtan Gilbert contributed code fix and 10takla reported version conflict issue
repositories.contributors:
- [Gaëtan Gilbert](https://github.com/SkySkimmer) implemented fix for `-short-paths` configuration in Merlin integration, modifying `merlin_config.ml` to use correct default values ([#1579](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1579))
- [@10takla](https://github.com/10takla) reported OCaml version conflict between ocamlformat-mlx and ocaml-lsp-server dependencies ([#1578](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1578))
- Automated dependency updates processed by GitHub Actions bot for Nix flake dependencies ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1437))

repositories.brief_summary: Version 3.22 released with trace improvements, cram shell customization, and install path fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: New trace subcommand, cram shell customization, structured logging, and install path handling improvements
repositories.new_features:
- **Version bumped to 3.22** with updated documentation across Coq and Rocq modules ([#13082](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13082))
- New `dune trace cat` **subcommand** for viewing trace files directly ([#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13055))
- **Cram stanza** now supports customizable shell with new `(shell <sh|bash>)` field allowing users to specify `bash` instead of default `sh` ([#13083](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13083))
- **Structured logging** implementation moves all logging statements to trace file with structured payloads ([#13015](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13015))
- **File watching events** added to trace file for better observability ([#13038](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13038))
- **Diagnostic events** now included in trace output ([#13041](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13041))
- Fixed `dune install --prefix` to properly handle **relative paths** outside workspace like `../foo` ([#12993](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12993))
- Fixed failure to **digest installed directory targets**, now allowing them as dependencies to other rules ([#13045](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13045))
- **Compiler pins** now properly propagate to dev tool solver ([#13033](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13033))
- **Melange** runtime dependencies with directory targets now properly installed and resolved ([#13042](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13042), [#13048](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13048))
- Reverted copyfile change fixing **macOS compatibility** issues with exec format errors ([#13069](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13069))
- Updated **ocaml-lmdb** vendor dependency fixing build issues on OpenBSD and NetBSD ([#13074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13074))
- Documentation update for cram `setup_scripts` field ([#13010](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13010))
repositories.activity_summary: Eleven new PRs opened including runtest improvements and odoc v3 rewrite, plus refactoring of trace infrastructure
repositories.activity:
- Newly **opened PRs** this week include trace format migration to csexp by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059)), concurrent install entries by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([#13054](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13054)), cram command timing by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092)), and using 3.22 in dune's own build ([#13089](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13089))
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) opened **runtest for tests stanza** implementation ([#13064](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13064)) fixing long-standing [#870](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/870) from 2018, plus RPC locking fix ([#12979](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12979)) and ctypes validation test ([#13000](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13000))
- **Large odoc v3 rules rewrite** remains in draft by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) with over 5400 lines added ([#12995](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12995)), plus markdown generation support by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) ([#12581](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12581))
- [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) delivered **package management improvements** including nested dune call fix ([#12902](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12902)), internal sed implementation for pkg tests ([#13040](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13040), [#13035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13035)), and lock normalization ([#13034](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13034))
- [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) completed **parser generator refactoring** by porting ocamllex and ocamlyacc rules to standalone stanzas ([#13075](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13075), [#13061](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13061)) and refactoring install entry handling ([#13058](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13058), [#13068](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13068), [#13046](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13046))
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) led **trace infrastructure overhaul** with dune trace subcommand ([#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13055)), removing custom output support ([#13071](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13071)), and refactoring trace file handling ([#13056](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13056), [#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13050), [#13049](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13049), [#13051](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13051))
- **Test suite reorganization** moved ocamllex and ocamlyacc tests to dedicated directories ([#13086](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13086), [#13093](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13093)), added jq stdlib and dependencies ([#13067](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13067), [#13065](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13065)), and moved unit tests ([#13044](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13044), [#13043](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13043))
- [Brendan Zabarauskas](https://github.com/brendanzab) landed **long-pending menhir test** for sibling modules in qualified parsers originally opened in 2024 ([#11118](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11118))
- Multiple tests added demonstrating **ocamlyacc and ocamllex limitations** with dynamic modules and include_subdirs ([#13094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13094), [#13090](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13090), [#13087](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13087), [#13079](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13079), [#13066](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13066), [#13060](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13060))
- [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) has **dev tool error clarity** PR open addressing uninstalled tool errors ([#12978](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12978))
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) added **reproduction case** for dev tool constraint issues ([#13036](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13036)) and contributed pkg tutorial documentation ([#13007](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13007))
- **Platform fixes** delivered including macOS exec format error revert by [Sergey Fedorov](https://github.com/barracuda156) ([#13069](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13069)), Nix codesign dependency by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([#13047](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13047)), and test suite macOS compatibility ([#13073](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13073))
- **CI improvements** include unique cache prefix enforcement ([#13091](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13091)) and nix flakes update ([#13088](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13088))
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) performed **error handling refactoring** ([#13039](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13039)) and rev store lock truncation fix ([#13030](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13030))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on trace/logging infrastructure, test organization, and platform compatibility improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Trace infrastructure modernization** with multiple PRs migrating to structured logging, adding new trace subcommands, and preparing for csexp format migration ([#13015](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13015), [#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13055), [#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059), [#13038](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13038), [#13041](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13041))
- **Test suite quality improvements** through systematic reorganization of ocamllex, ocamlyacc, and menhir tests into dedicated directories, plus extensive test coverage for edge cases and limitations ([#13086](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13086), [#13093](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13093), [#13090](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13090), [#13087](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13087), [#13094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13094))
- **Parser generator refactoring** moving ocamllex and ocamlyacc from legacy Rule_conf to standalone stanzas, providing cleaner architecture ([#13075](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13075), [#13061](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13061))
- **Package management maturation** with continued refinements to dune pkg including dev tool solver improvements, internal sed implementation for test portability, and submodule support ([#13033](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13033), [#13040](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13040), [#13032](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13032))
- **Platform compatibility focus** addressing OpenBSD, NetBSD, macOS, and Haiku build issues through vendor updates and targeted fixes ([#13074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13074), [#13069](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13069), [#13077](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13077), [#13076](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13076))
- **Install and deployment improvements** fixing directory target digesting, relative path handling in install prefix, and melange runtime dependency resolution ([#13045](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13045), [#12993](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12993), [#13042](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13042))
- **Cram testing enhancements** with shell customization, setup scripts documentation, and command timing features improving test flexibility ([#13083](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13083), [#13010](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13010), [#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092))
repositories.contributors_summary: Eight active contributors led by Grinberg on trace infrastructure, Monteiro on refactoring, and Caglayan on features
repositories.contributors:
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) led **trace and logging infrastructure** overhaul implementing structured logging ([#13015](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13015)), dune trace subcommand ([#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13055)), trace format refactoring ([#13056](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13056), [#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13050), [#13049](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13049), [#13051](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13051)), diagnostic and file watching events ([#13041](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13041), [#13038](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13038)), and opening csexp migration PR ([#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059))
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) also improved **cram testing** with shell customization ([#13083](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13083)), command timing ([#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092)), setup scripts documentation ([#13010](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13010)), jq integration ([#13067](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13067), [#13065](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13065)), and tuple-to-record refactoring ([#13085](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13085))
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) handled **maintenance and fixes** including version bump to 3.22 ([#13082](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13082), [#13089](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13089)), test suite fixes ([#13073](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13073), [#13063](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13063), [#13062](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13062), [#13053](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13053), [#13084](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13084)), error handling refactoring ([#13039](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13039)), and rev store lock fix ([#13030](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13030))
- [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) drove **refactoring initiatives** porting ocamlyacc and ocamllex to standalone stanzas ([#13075](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13075), [#13061](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13061)), refactoring install entries ([#13058](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13058), [#13068](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13068), [#13046](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13046)), and opening concurrent install entries PR ([#13054](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13054))
- [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) expanded **test coverage** with ocamllex and ocamlyacc tests demonstrating limitations and edge cases ([#13095](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13095), [#13094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13094), [#13093](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13093), [#13090](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13090), [#13087](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13087), [#13086](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13086), [#13079](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13079), [#13078](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13078), [#13066](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13066), [#13060](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13060), [#13045](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13045))
- [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) fixed **melange issues** with directory target installation and runtime dependencies ([#13042](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13042), [#13048](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13048)) plus Nix codesign dependency ([#13047](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13047)) and nix flakes update ([#13088](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13088))
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) implemented **runtest for tests stanza** closing seven-year-old issue ([#13064](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13064)), fixed OpenBSD/NetBSD build with lmdb bump ([#13074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13074)), enforced unique CI cache prefixes ([#13091](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13091)), and opened RPC locking fix ([#12979](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12979)) plus ctypes validation test ([#13000](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13000))
- [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) improved **package management** with nested dune call fix ([#12902](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12902)), internal sed implementation for pkg tests ([#13040](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13040), [#13035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13035)), lock normalization ([#13034](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13034)), and submodule test update ([#13032](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13032))
- [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) fixed **install prefix path handling** for relative paths outside workspace ([#12993](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12993)), compiler pin propagation to dev tool solver ([#13033](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13033)), and opened dev tool error clarity PR ([#12978](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12978))
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) contributed **documentation** for pkg tutorial with dune show depexts ([#13007](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13007)) and opened reproduction case for dev tool constraints ([#13036](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13036))
- [Sergey Fedorov](https://github.com/barracuda156) fixed **macOS compatibility** by reverting problematic copyfile change ([#13069](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13069))
- [Brendan Zabarauskas](https://github.com/brendanzab) landed **menhir test** for qualified parser sibling modules originally opened in 2024 ([#11118](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11118))
- [@haochenx](https://github.com/haochenx) contributed to **cram shell customization** feature ([#13083](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13083))
- [@jonludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) continues work on **odoc v3 rules** rewrite with over 5400 additions ([#12995](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12995))
- [@davesnx](https://github.com/davesnx) has open PR for **markdown generation** support in odoc ([#12581](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12581))

repositories.brief_summary: Exception logging improvements merged, new blog content scraped, website downtime resolved
repositories.new_features_summary: Added exception logging with detailed error reporting for YouTube feed scraping failures
repositories.new_features: - Improved **error handling** in YouTube feed scraper with exception logging that reports source name, URL, and error details when feeds cannot be fetched ([#3433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3433))
repositories.activity_summary: One new PR opened to add blog source, automated content scraping merged, website outage resolved
repositories.activity:
- **New blog source** proposed by [Chris Armstrong](https://github.com/chris-armstrong) to add OCaml-related posts from chrisarmstrong.dev to the planet feed ([#3428](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3428))
- **Automated content scraping** merged three PRs adding new OCaml blog posts and videos to the planet ([#3429](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3429), [#3430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3430), [#3431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3431))
- **Website downtime** on December 26 reported by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with connections timing out, resolved by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) ([#3432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3432))
repositories.contributors_summary: Cuihtlauac Alvarado improved error logging, Chris Armstrong proposed new blog source, community members resolved website outage
repositories.contributors:
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) implemented exception logging for the YouTube feed scraper to provide better diagnostics when feed fetching fails ([#3433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3433))
- [Chris Armstrong](https://github.com/chris-armstrong) opened a PR to add his blog's OCaml-related posts to the planet sources ([#3428](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3428))
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) reported the website outage on December 26 when connections were timing out ([#3432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3432))
- [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) resolved the website downtime issue and brought the site back online ([#3432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3432))
- Automated scraping workflows continued to add new OCaml blog posts and videos from various sources to keep the planet feed updated ([#3429](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3429), [#3430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3430), [#3431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3431))

repositories.brief_summary: Package ecosystem growth with 11 new packages and updates including QCheck 0.91, Sail 0.20.1, and MLX 0.11
repositories.new_features_summary: New packages: polymarket, shellwords, frontmatter_extractor, menhir-lsp; Updates: QCheck, Sail, MLX, opam-check-npm-deps
repositories.new_features:
- **New package `polymarket.0.1.0`** providing OCaml client library for Polymarket prediction market API with market data retrieval and order management ([#29133](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29133))
- **New package `shellwords.1.0.0`** implementing POSIX shell command word parsing and quoting utilities, compatible with Rust shell-words crate ([#29126](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29126))
- **New package `frontmatter_extractor.0.1`** for extracting front-matter sections from text files with YAML support ([#29129](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29129))
- **New package `menhir-lsp.0.1.1`** providing Language Server Protocol implementation for Menhir and ocamllex with navigation and completion features ([#29137](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29137))
- **QCheck 0.91** released with compatibility updates across qcheck, qcheck-core, qcheck-alcotest, and qcheck-ounit packages ([#29123](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29123))
- **Sail 0.20.1** bugfix release with loop syntax improvements and unification of `bit` type with `bits(1)` type ([#29124](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29124))
- **MLX 0.11** updated with OCaml 5.4 support and Windows fixes ([#29134](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29134))
- **opam-check-npm-deps 4.1.0** now supports opam 2.5 and removes most vendored code ([#29131](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29131))
- **Pacomb 1.4.1** parser combinator library adds `not charset` combinator and compatibility with latest OCaml and ppxlib ([#29122](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29122))
- **Expr 0.6.0** adds string parsing and comparison capabilities ([#29138](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29138))
- **QuickJS 0.4.1** updated to remove uutf dependency ([#29125](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29125))
- **conf-taglib_c.2** extended with Debian 13+ support ([#29141](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29141))
- **synchronizer.0.2** merged with updated package metadata ([#29113](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29113))
repositories.activity_summary: Active week with 4 new PRs opened including shakuhachi, jupyter, rpclib, and reason-react packages
repositories.activity:
- **New PR opened** for `shakuhachi.0.1.0` music collection manager and tagger by [@EruEri](https://github.com/EruEri) encountering CI feedback on `conf-taglib_c` failures and dependency bounds ([#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136))
- **New PR opened** for `jupyter.3.0.1` OCaml kernel for Jupyter notebooks by [Eugene Lykhovyd](https://github.com/zhelih), superseding previous version due to OCaml 5.4 compatibility issues ([#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142))
- **New PR opened** for `rpclib 10.0.0` (6 packages) by [Pau Ruiz Safont](https://github.com/psafont) adding Python3 support, dropping Python2, with ongoing investigation of riscv64 test failures ([#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075))
- **New PR opened** for `reason-react 0.17.0` (2 packages) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) upgrading ppxlib to 0.36, encountering reverse dependency failures requiring additional bounds ([#29132](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29132))
- **posix packages 3.1.0** (10 packages) under active iteration by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) addressing BSD compatibility and network sandboxing issues in tests ([#29128](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29128))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) provided extensive **CI review and feedback** across multiple PRs including lower bounds issues, dependency failures, and platform-specific build problems ([#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136), [#29131](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29131), [#29123](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29123), [#29122](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29122), [#29124](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29124), [#29125](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29125), [#29137](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29137), [#29138](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29138), [#29133](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29133), [#29134](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29134))
repositories.trends_summary: Continued ecosystem maturation with OCaml 5.4 compatibility updates and build system improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.4 compatibility** emerging as priority across ecosystem with multiple packages updating to support latest compiler version ([#29134](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29134), [#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142))
- **Dependency lower bounds** receiving increased attention from CI review process catching compatibility issues early ([#29131](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29131), [#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136), [#29122](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29122))
- **Configuration package maintenance** demonstrated by `conf-taglib_c` updates for newer distribution versions ([#29141](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29141))
- **Language Server Protocol** support expanding with menhir-lsp providing editor integration for parser development ([#29137](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29137))
- **Cross-language compatibility** patterns emerging with packages like shellwords targeting behavior compatibility with Rust implementations ([#29126](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29126))
- **Platform-specific testing** improvements with sandboxing and architecture-specific issues being identified and addressed ([#29128](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29128), [#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075))

repositories.brief_summary: Parser bug report for arrow functions in for loops and ongoing effects-based Stack Switching implementation
repositories.activity_summary: Parser bug identified and ongoing WebAssembly effects implementation continues
repositories.activity:
- **JavaScript parser bug** reported by [Spotandjake](https://github.com/spotandjake) where arrow functions in for loop variable definitions fail to parse, discovered while integrating libbinaryen ES6 package ([#2139](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2139))
- **WebAssembly effects implementation** based on Stack Switching proposal continues as draft PR by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon), requiring Binaryen 124+ and producing Wasm code executable by Wizard engine with stack-switching extension ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1832))
repositories.contributors_summary: Spotandjake reported parser issue and Jérôme Vouillon continued effects implementation work
repositories.contributors:
- [Spotandjake](https://github.com/spotandjake) reported JavaScript parser bug affecting arrow functions in for loop definitions, including reproduction case and context about encountering the issue with libbinaryen ([#2139](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2139))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) continues maintaining the effects implementation PR based on WebAssembly Stack Switching proposal, which received activity updates this week ([#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1832))

repositories.brief_summary: Jkind error reporting improvements, CFG backend bug fixes, and new PRs for `or_null` type handling and ARM64 machine code emitter
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed environment scoping in jkind error messages and prevented irreducible control flow graph generation in backend
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **environment scoping** in jkind error messages to ensure proper type variable printing with correct context ([#5173](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5173), [7139ba3](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/7139ba3a7ced1db9a815124087f158d61a4b1be8))
- Enhanced **jkind printing comments** for better code clarity and maintainability ([#5175](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5175), [a464ed3](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/a464ed368c8fde608458f7c6e4753829b7dc94b7))
- Fixed **simplify terminator pass** in CFG backend to guard transformations that could render control flow graphs irreducible, ensuring loop information remains valid ([#5174](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5174), [e51c71f](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/e51c71f011c895f0c29bc00a8ad31742520b5e10))
- Updated **scannable axes documentation** with comprehensive coverage of kind system extensions including `non_pointer`, `non_null`, and separability features ([#5170](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5170), [103610e](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/103610efe6cbff26c9737231ea077e661760ee8d))
repositories.activity_summary: New PRs for `or_null` type improvements, ARM64 binary emitter, and unboxed keywords; ongoing work on effects, preemption, and layout polymorphism
repositories.activity:
- **New `or_null` type handling work** by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) with PRs addressing imprecise separability in `type_jkind` ([#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178)) and improved layout estimation for `or_null` instances ([#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176))
- **ARM64 binary emitter** introduced by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) as new machine code emitter with typed DSL for ARM64 architecture, making ocaml-jit library architecture-independent ([#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177))
- **Unboxed keywords feature** proposed by [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) adding `#;`, `#if`, `#assert`, `#while`, `#for`, `#when`, and `#<-` variants that work with `unit#` and `bool#` instead of boxed types ([#5167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5167))
- **Quotation system improvements** by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) including infrastructure for type inspection information merged ([#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090)) and ongoing work on record/variant disambiguation under quotes ([#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094))
- **Stage checking for record labels** progressing with [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) implementing proper stage checks preventing labels from crossing quotation locks ([#5158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5158))
- **Nix installation improvements** by [George Shammas](https://github.com/georgyo) switching to Cachix install action to avoid download timeouts ([#5168](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5168))
- **Effects and runtime work** includes [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) implementing preemption support ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), refactoring effect primitives ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)), removing thread-local dynamic bindings ([#5171](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5171)), and implementing Dynamic in stdlib ([#5172](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5172))
- **Backend and optimization work** continuing with [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) developing the dissector pass for linking large executables beyond 2GB ([#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146)), [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) fixing ARM64 large stack offsets ([#5130](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5130)), and [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) adding unsigned division primitives ([#4936](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4936))
- **Type system enhancements** with [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) working on implicit kinds ([#4285](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4285)), [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) making non-`value` base kinds cross externality by default ([#5162](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5162)), and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) preparing scannable axes implementation in draft PR ([#5169](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5169))
- **Layout polymorphism infrastructure** advancing with [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) adding slambda constructors for static evaluation support ([#5148](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5148)) and [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) enabling functors with non-legacy mode input/output ([#5107](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5107))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on advanced type system features including `or_null` handling, unboxed types, effects-based preemption, and ARM64 backend development
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **`or_null` type refinement** emerging as focus area with multiple PRs addressing jkind accuracy and layout estimation for nullable types ([#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178), [#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176), [#5169](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5169))
- **Unboxed type ergonomics** improving with new unboxed keywords proposal and documentation updates for scannable axes ([#5167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5167), [#5170](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5170))
- **Effects and preemption infrastructure** maturing through runtime refactoring and dynamic bindings work ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881), [#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901), [#5171](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5171), [#5172](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5172))
- **ARM64 architecture support** expanding with binary emitter implementation and stack offset fixes ([#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177), [#5130](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5130))
- **Stage checking rigor** increasing with proper enforcement for record labels and quotation boundaries ([#5158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5158), [#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094))
- **Large executable support** developing through dissector pass allowing 2GB+ binaries without large code model overhead ([#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc), [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa), and [George Shammas](https://github.com/georgyo) on merged PRs; extensive review activity from [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) and [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin)
repositories.contributors:

- [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) fixed CFG simplify terminator pass to prevent irreducible control flow graphs ([#5174](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5174)) and continues work on ARM64 large stack offsets ([#5130](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5130)) with code review support from [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell)
- [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) merged scannable axes documentation updates ([#5170](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5170)) with review feedback from [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach), and opened PRs for `or_null` separability fixes ([#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178)) and layout estimation improvements ([#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176))
- [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) merged infrastructure for type inspection in quotes ([#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090)) and continues work on record/variant disambiguation ([#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094)) with extensive review discussions with [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian)
- [George Shammas](https://github.com/georgyo) improved CI reliability by switching to Cachix Nix installation ([#5168](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5168))
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) introduced comprehensive ARM64 binary emitter with typed DSL ([#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177)) and continues development of dissector pass for large executables ([#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146)) with review support from [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc)
- [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) proposed unboxed keywords feature ([#5167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5167)) and works on making base kinds cross externality ([#5162](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5162)) with feedback from [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere)
- [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) continues preemption implementation ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), effect primitives refactoring ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)), and Dynamic stdlib work ([#5171](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5171), [#5172](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5172))
- [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) implements proper stage checking for record labels ([#5158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5158)) with detailed review feedback from [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn)
- [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) provided extensive code review across multiple PRs including implicit kinds ([#4285](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4285)), `or_null` layout estimation ([#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176)), jkind errors ([#5173](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5173)), and externality crossing ([#5162](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5162))
- [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) contributed detailed reviews on slambda constructors ([#5148](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5148)) and jkind printing fixes ([#5173](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5173))
- [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) continues slambda constructors implementation ([#5148](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5148)) with feedback from [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell)
- [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) advances functors with non-legacy modes ([#5107](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5107)) and provides thorough review on stage checking ([#5158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5158))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) continues implicit kinds development ([#4285](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4285)) with review from [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere)
- [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) works on unsigned division primitives for native and bytecode ([#4936](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4936))

repositories.brief_summary: Comment formatting improvements merged, two draft PRs opened for fair scheduler and multififo optimizations

- **Multififo optimizations** in progress with draft PR tweaking the implementation ([#381](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/381))

repositories.brief_summary: Issue discussions on exception context handling, Fiber.any race conditions, and io_uring security concerns
repositories.activity_summary: Two issues closed with discussions on exception handling patterns and fiber cancellation behavior
repositories.activity:
- [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) opened [#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825) proposing `Exn.with_context` helper to reduce exception handling boilerplate, which was closed after [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) explained that the approach would lose backtrace information due to tail-call optimization
- Nested `Fiber.any` **race condition** issue [#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805) reported by [Adam Cholewiński](https://github.com/adamchol) was closed following the merge of [#806](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/806) which prioritizes returning fiber values over quick cancellation
- **io_uring security** discussion continued on [#797](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/797) with [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) commenting about test suite compatibility issues with ZFS filesystems
repositories.discussions_summary: Exception handling patterns and fiber cancellation semantics clarified through issue discussions
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Exception context helper** debate in [#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825) where [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) proposed `Exn.with_context` to reduce try-catch boilerplate, and [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) explained the backtrace preservation tradeoff that makes the manual pattern necessary
- **Fiber.any cancellation** semantics clarified in [#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805) where nested fiber behavior was initially unexpected by [Adam Cholewiński](https://github.com/adamchol), resolved by earlier changes in [#806](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/806) that improved value return prioritization
repositories.contributors_summary: Community discussions led by Volker Diels-Grabsch, Thomas Leonard, and Adam Cholewiński on API patterns and behavior
repositories.contributors:
- [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) opened [#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825) exploring exception handling patterns and commented on ZFS test suite issues in [#797](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/797)
- [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) provided technical explanation on backtrace preservation in exception handling patterns in [#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825)
- [Adam Cholewiński](https://github.com/adamchol) reported nested `Fiber.any` behavior in [#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805) which was resolved by previous work in [#806](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/806)

group_summaries.brief_summary: Package ecosystem expanded with 11 new packages while ocaml.org improved reliability with error logging and uptime fixes
group_summaries.new_features_summary: New packages: menhir-lsp, polymarket, shellwords, frontmatter_extractor; Updates: QCheck, Sail, MLX, opam-check-npm-deps
group_summaries.new_features:
- **New package `menhir-lsp.0.1.1`** providing Language Server Protocol implementation for Menhir and ocamllex with navigation and completion features ([ocaml/opam-repository#29137](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29137))
- **New package `polymarket.0.1.0`** providing OCaml client library for Polymarket prediction market API with market data retrieval and order management ([ocaml/opam-repository#29133](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29133))
- **New package `shellwords.1.0.0`** implementing POSIX shell command word parsing and quoting utilities, compatible with Rust shell-words crate ([ocaml/opam-repository#29126](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29126))
- **New package `frontmatter_extractor.0.1`** for extracting front-matter sections from text files with YAML support ([ocaml/opam-repository#29129](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29129))
- **QCheck 0.91** released with compatibility updates across qcheck, qcheck-core, qcheck-alcotest, and qcheck-ounit packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#29123](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29123))
- **Sail 0.20.1** bugfix release with loop syntax improvements and unification of `bit` type with `bits(1)` type ([ocaml/opam-repository#29124](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29124))
- **MLX 0.11** updated with OCaml 5.4 support and Windows fixes ([ocaml/opam-repository#29134](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29134))
- **opam-check-npm-deps 4.1.0** now supports opam 2.5 and removes most vendored code ([ocaml/opam-repository#29131](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29131))
- **Pacomb 1.4.1** parser combinator library adds `not charset` combinator and compatibility with latest OCaml and ppxlib ([ocaml/opam-repository#29122](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29122))
- **Expr 0.6.0** adds string parsing and comparison capabilities ([ocaml/opam-repository#29138](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29138))
- **QuickJS 0.4.1** updated to remove uutf dependency ([ocaml/opam-repository#29125](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29125))
- **conf-taglib_c.2** extended with Debian 13+ support ([ocaml/opam-repository#29141](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29141))
- **Improved error handling** in ocaml.org YouTube feed scraper with exception logging that reports source name, URL, and error details when feeds cannot be fetched ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3433))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Package ecosystem growth** with 11 new packages merged to [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) including Language Server Protocol support for Menhir, API client libraries, and utility packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#29137](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29137), [ocaml/opam-repository#29133](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29133), [ocaml/opam-repository#29126](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29126), [ocaml/opam-repository#29129](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29129))
- **Major package updates** across testing frameworks (QCheck 0.91), specification languages (Sail 0.20.1), and platform support libraries (MLX 0.11) with OCaml 5.4 compatibility improvements ([ocaml/opam-repository#29123](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29123), [ocaml/opam-repository#29124](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29124), [ocaml/opam-repository#29134](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29134))
- **Website stability** maintained for [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) with December 26 downtime quickly resolved and error logging improvements for better diagnostics ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3432), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3433))
- **Active PR pipeline** with 4 new package submissions in opam-repository including major version updates for rpclib, reason-react, posix packages, and jupyter ([ocaml/opam-repository#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075), [ocaml/opam-repository#29132](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29132), [ocaml/opam-repository#29128](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29128), [ocaml/opam-repository#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142))
- **Content expansion** on ocaml.org with automated scraping adding new blog posts and videos, plus proposal for new blog source from chrisarmstrong.dev ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3429](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3429), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3430), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3431), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3428](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3428))
group_summaries.activity_summary: Active week with ongoing PRs for shakuhachi, jupyter, rpclib, reason-react, and posix packages addressing CI feedback
group_summaries.activity:
- **synchronizer 0.2** merged to opam-repository with updated package metadata ([ocaml/opam-repository#29113](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29113))
- **New PR opened** for `shakuhachi.0.1.0` music collection manager and tagger by [@EruEri](https://github.com/EruEri) encountering CI feedback on `conf-taglib_c` failures and dependency bounds ([ocaml/opam-repository#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136))
