- **Website downtime** on December 26 reported by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with connections timing out, resolved by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3432))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) provided extensive **CI review and feedback** across multiple opam-repository PRs including lower bounds issues, dependency failures, and platform-specific build problems ([ocaml/opam-repository#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136), [ocaml/opam-repository#29131](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29131), [ocaml/opam-repository#29123](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29123), [ocaml/opam-repository#29122](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29122), [ocaml/opam-repository#29124](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29124), [ocaml/opam-repository#29125](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29125), [ocaml/opam-repository#29137](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29137), [ocaml/opam-repository#29138](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29138), [ocaml/opam-repository#29133](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29133), [ocaml/opam-repository#29134](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29134))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **opam 2.5 support** demonstrated in opam-check-npm-deps 4.1.0 release, showing progress toward next opam version while opam-repository continues managing packages for current versions ([ocaml/opam-repository#29131](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29131))
- **Community infrastructure reliability** maintained across both repositories with responsive incident handling for ocaml.org downtime and continuous CI review ensuring package quality in opam-repository ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3432), [ocaml/opam-repository#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136))
- **Package discovery and documentation** supported through ocaml.org's content aggregation complementing opam-repository's package management, with new blog sources expanding community visibility ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3428](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3428))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.4 compatibility** becoming priority across ecosystem with multiple packages updating to support latest compiler version, including MLX and jupyter packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#29134](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29134), [ocaml/opam-repository#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142))
- **Dependency lower bounds** receiving increased attention from CI review process catching compatibility issues early across package submissions ([ocaml/opam-repository#29131](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29131), [ocaml/opam-repository#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136), [ocaml/opam-repository#29122](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29122))
- **Language Server Protocol support** expanding with menhir-lsp providing editor integration for parser development, continuing trend of improved developer tooling ([ocaml/opam-repository#29137](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29137))
- **Cross-language compatibility** patterns emerging with packages like shellwords targeting behavior compatibility with implementations in other languages ([ocaml/opam-repository#29126](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29126))
- **Platform-specific testing improvements** with sandboxing and architecture-specific issues being identified and addressed, particularly for BSD compatibility and riscv64 support ([ocaml/opam-repository#29128](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29128), [ocaml/opam-repository#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075))
- **Operational visibility** improvements through better error logging and diagnostics, exemplified by YouTube feed scraper exception reporting on ocaml.org ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3433))
- **Configuration package maintenance** continuing with updates for newer distribution versions, ensuring ecosystem compatibility with evolving Linux distributions ([ocaml/opam-repository#29141](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29141))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Dune 3.22 released with trace improvements and cram customization while opam fixed Windows lock handling
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Dune 3.22 with trace subcommand and cram shell customization, opam format upgrade fix, ocaml-lsp short-paths fix
group_summaries.new_features:
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: Version 3.22 released with new `dune trace cat` subcommand for viewing trace files ([ocaml/dune#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13055)), cram stanza shell customization allowing `bash` instead of default `sh` ([ocaml/dune#13083](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13083)), structured logging implementation ([ocaml/dune#13015](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13015)), file watching and diagnostic events in traces ([ocaml/dune#13038](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13038), [ocaml/dune#13041](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13041))
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: Fixed `dune install --prefix` to handle relative paths outside workspace like `../foo` ([ocaml/dune#12993](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12993)), directory target digesting for use as dependencies ([ocaml/dune#13045](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13045)), compiler pin propagation to dev tool solver ([ocaml/dune#13033](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13033)), and Melange runtime dependencies with directory targets ([ocaml/dune#13042](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13042))
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: Platform fixes including macOS compatibility by reverting copyfile change ([ocaml/dune#13069](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13069)) and updated ocaml-lmdb fixing OpenBSD/NetBSD builds ([ocaml/dune#13074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13074))
- **[ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam)**: Fixed format upgrade lock handling on Windows by reusing global lock file descriptor instead of reopening, preventing failures during switch and repository format upgrades ([ocaml/opam#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839))
- **[ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp)**: Fixed `-short-paths` configuration for Merlin by removing incorrect `real_paths = false` default ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1579](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1579))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) released version 3.22 with trace infrastructure improvements, cram testing enhancements, and install path fixes while continuing parser generator refactoring and test suite reorganization
- [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) merged Windows lock handling fix for format upgrades with ongoing work on nushell support, source caching optimization, and repository configuration redesign
- [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) fixed Merlin `-short-paths` configuration handling in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1579](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1579)
- [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) received bug report about Reason syntax output regression in OCaml 5.3+ ([ocaml/merlin#2019](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2019))
- [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) had JavaScript parser bug reported for arrow functions in for loops ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2139](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2139)) with ongoing WebAssembly effects implementation ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1832))
- [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind), [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc), [ocaml/opam-file-format](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-file-format), and [ocaml-dune/spawn](https://github.com/ocaml-dune/spawn) had no activity this week
group_summaries.activity_summary: Dune refactoring parser generators and trace infrastructure, opam advancing nushell and caching work
group_summaries.activity:
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) leading trace infrastructure modernization with csexp format migration PR ([ocaml/dune#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059)), trace format refactoring ([ocaml/dune#13056](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13056), [ocaml/dune#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13050)), and cram command timing ([ocaml/dune#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092))
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) completing parser generator refactoring by porting ocamllex and ocamlyacc to standalone stanzas ([ocaml/dune#13075](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13075), [ocaml/dune#13061](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13061)), refactoring install entry handling ([ocaml/dune#13058](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13058), [ocaml/dune#13068](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13068)), and opening concurrent install entries PR ([ocaml/dune#13054](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13054))
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) implementing runtest for tests stanza closing seven-year-old [ocaml/dune#870](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/870) ([ocaml/dune#13064](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13064)) and opening RPC locking fix ([ocaml/dune#12979](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12979))
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) advancing package management with internal sed implementation for pkg tests ([ocaml/dune#13040](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13040), [ocaml/dune#13035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13035)), nested dune call fix ([ocaml/dune#12902](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12902)), and lock normalization ([ocaml/dune#13034](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13034))
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: Test suite reorganization moving ocamllex and ocamlyacc tests to dedicated directories ([ocaml/dune#13086](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13086), [ocaml/dune#13093](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13093)) with extensive coverage of edge cases ([ocaml/dune#13094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13094), [ocaml/dune#13090](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13090), [ocaml/dune#13087](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13087))
- **[ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune)**: Large odoc v3 rules rewrite remains in draft by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) with over 5400 lines added ([ocaml/dune#12995](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12995))
- **[ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam)**: [Benjamin Voisin](https://github.com/benjamin-voisin) working on nushell shell support to enable `opam env` with JSON output format ([ocaml/opam#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330), [ocaml/opam#6649](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6649))
- **[ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam)**: [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) developing source caching optimization to save disk space by only caching dev packages ([ocaml/opam#6440](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6440))
- **[ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam)**: [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) redesigning internal repository configuration format with labeled section fields ([ocaml/opam#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393))
- **[ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp)**: [Gaëtan Gilbert](https://github.com/SkySkimmer) opened PR fixing `-short-paths` configuration for Merlin ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1579](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1579) addressing [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1395))
- **[ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml)**: [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) continuing WebAssembly effects implementation based on Stack Switching proposal ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1832](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1832))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) active across multiple repositories: extensive [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) refactoring work ([ocaml/dune#13075](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13075), [ocaml/dune#13061](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13061)) and reporting Reason syntax regression in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) ([ocaml/merlin#2019](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2019))
- Merlin integration improvements spanning repositories: [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) fixing `-short-paths` configuration ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1579](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1579)) addresses issues stemming from [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) behavior
- Platform compatibility focus across toolchain: [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) fixing macOS and BSD builds ([ocaml/dune#13069](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13069), [ocaml/dune#13074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13074)) while [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) addresses Windows lock handling ([ocaml/opam#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839))
- Documentation generation ecosystem: ongoing [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) odoc v3 rules rewrite ([ocaml/dune#12995](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12995)) will impact [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) integration
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **File timestamp preservation regression** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) ≥ 2.2 discussed by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) where source files lose timestamps when copied to build directory, triggering unnecessary automake regeneration and exposing missing dependencies ([ocaml/opam#6693](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6693), caused by [ocaml/opam#4823](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4823))
- **OCaml version conflict** reported by [@10takla](https://github.com/10takla) between ocamlformat-mlx (requires ocaml < "5.4") and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) server (requires ocaml >= "5.4") ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1578](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1578))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Trace and observability infrastructure** receiving focused development in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with structured logging migration ([ocaml/dune#13015](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13015)), new trace subcommands ([ocaml/dune#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13055)), csexp format migration ([ocaml/dune#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059)), and enriched event coverage ([ocaml/dune#13038](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13038), [ocaml/dune#13041](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13041))
- **Platform compatibility improvements** across build and package management tools: [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) fixing macOS exec format errors ([ocaml/dune#13069](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13069)) and BSD builds ([ocaml/dune#13074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13074)), [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) addressing Windows lock handling ([ocaml/opam#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839)) and improving alternative shell support ([ocaml/opam#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330))
- **Test infrastructure quality** emphasis in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) through systematic test suite reorganization ([ocaml/dune#13086](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13086), [ocaml/dune#13093](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13093)), comprehensive edge case coverage ([ocaml/dune#13094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13094), [ocaml/dune#13090](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13090)), cram testing enhancements ([ocaml/dune#13083](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13083), [ocaml/dune#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092)), and jq integration ([ocaml/dune#13067](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13067))
- **Parser generator refactoring** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) moving ocamllex and ocamlyacc from legacy Rule_conf to standalone stanzas for cleaner architecture ([ocaml/dune#13075](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13075), [ocaml/dune#13061](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13061))
- **Package management optimization** initiatives in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) focusing on disk space efficiency through selective source caching ([ocaml/opam#6440](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6440)) and internal configuration improvements ([ocaml/opam#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393))
- **Documentation generation evolution** with large odoc v3 rules rewrite in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ([ocaml/dune#12995](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12995)) preparing for next generation documentation tooling

group_summaries.brief_summary: Type system refinements with jkind error improvements, CFG backend fixes, and ongoing work on `or_null` types and ARM64 support
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed environment scoping in jkind errors and CFG simplifier to prevent irreducible graphs
group_summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **environment scoping** in jkind error messages to ensure proper type variable printing with correct context in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5173](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5173) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- Enhanced **jkind printing comments** for better code clarity and maintainability in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5175](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5175) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- Fixed **simplify terminator pass** in CFG backend to guard transformations that could render control flow graphs irreducible, ensuring loop information remains valid in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5174](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5174) by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc)
- Updated **scannable axes documentation** with comprehensive coverage of kind system extensions including `non_pointer`, `non_null`, and separability features in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5170](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5170) by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa)
group_summaries.group_overview:
- Activity concentrated in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 4 merged PRs addressing jkind error reporting and CFG backend correctness
- New PRs opened for `or_null` type handling improvements in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176)
- ARM64 machine code emitter introduced in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177) to make ocaml-jit library architecture-independent
- Unboxed keywords proposal in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5167) adding syntax variants for `unit#` and `bool#`
- No activity recorded in oxcaml/opam-repository, oxcaml/merlin, oxcaml/js_of_ocaml, or janestreet/opam-repository
group_summaries.activity_summary: New PRs for `or_null` types, ARM64 emitter, unboxed keywords; ongoing effects, quotations, and layout polymorphism work
group_summaries.activity:
- **`or_null` type refinement** with new PRs addressing imprecise separability in `type_jkind` ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178)) and improved layout estimation for `or_null` instances ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176)) by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa)
- **ARM64 binary emitter** introduced by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) as typed DSL-based machine code emitter for ARM64 architecture in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177)
- **Unboxed keywords feature** proposed by [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) adding `#;`, `#if`, `#assert`, `#while`, `#for`, `#when`, and `#<-` variants for unboxed types in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5167)
- **Quotation system improvements** with type inspection infrastructure merged in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090) and record/variant disambiguation work in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094) by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski)
- **Stage checking for record labels** progressing in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5158) by [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) with review from [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn)
- **Effects and preemption work** advancing with preemption implementation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), effect primitives refactoring ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)), and Dynamic stdlib implementation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5172](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5172)) by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark)
- **Backend optimizations** including dissector pass for 2GB+ executables in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146) by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) and ARM64 large stack offsets fix in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5130](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5130) by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc)
- **Type system enhancements** with implicit kinds work in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4285](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4285) by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) and base kinds externality changes in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5162](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5162) by [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke)
- **Layout polymorphism infrastructure** advancing with slambda constructors in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5148](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5148) by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) and functors with non-legacy modes in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5107](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5107) by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn)
- **CI improvements** with Nix installation reliability fix in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5168](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5168) by [George Shammas](https://github.com/georgyo)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **`or_null` type system refinement** emerging with multiple PRs improving jkind separability analysis ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178)), layout estimation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176)), and scannable axes preparation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5169](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5169))
- **Unboxed type usability** improving through new keyword syntax proposal ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5167)) and expanded documentation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5170](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5170))
- **Effects-based preemption** maturing with runtime infrastructure refactoring in [oxcaml/oxcaml#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901), and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5171](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5171)
- **ARM64 backend development** expanding with binary emitter ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177)) and stack handling improvements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5130](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5130))
- **Quotation system rigor** increasing with stage checking enforcement in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5158) and disambiguation work in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094)
- **Large executable support** developing through dissector pass enabling 2GB+ binaries in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146)

group_summaries.brief_summary: String module additions and DragonFly BSD native backend support merged in ocaml/ocaml
group_summaries.new_features_summary: String.of_char, String.is_empty functions added; DragonFly BSD native compilation enabled
group_summaries.new_features:
- **String.of_char** function converts a single character to a string, providing clearer intent than `String.make 1 c` in [ocaml/ocaml#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14440) by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)
- **String.is_empty** predicate checks if a string is empty in [ocaml/ocaml#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14438) by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)
- **DragonFly BSD native backend** enabled, making `ocamlopt` available on DragonFly BSD x86_64 systems in [ocaml/ocaml#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14431) by [Michael Neumann](https://github.com/mneumann)
- **Testsuite enhancement** with new `not-root` builtin action allowing tests to be skipped when running as superuser in [ocaml/ocaml#14435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14435) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)
group_summaries.activity_summary: Seven new PRs opened for stdlib enhancements; String module expansion continues
group_summaries.activity:
- **String module expansion** continues with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) proposing comprehensive string processing capabilities in [ocaml/ocaml#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137), including search primitives with `find_{first,last}` and `find_all` in [ocaml/ocaml#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381), substring replacement with `replace_{first,last,all}` in [ocaml/ocaml#14436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14436), string splitting with `split_{first,last,all}` in [ocaml/ocaml#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14437), and affix checking with `String.includes` in [ocaml/ocaml#14439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14439)
- **Bit manipulation functions** proposed by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adding `popcount`, `nlz`, `ntz`, `nls`, and related bit counting functions to Int, Int32, Int64, and Nativeint modules using pure OCaml implementations based on Hacker's Delight algorithms in [ocaml/ocaml#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433)
- **Integer division operations** introduced by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) with `fdiv` (floor division), `cdiv` (ceil division), `ediv` (Euclidean division), and `emod` (Euclidean remainder) providing non-negative remainders suitable for modulo arithmetic in [ocaml/ocaml#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14432)
- **Unstable feature annotation** mechanism proposed by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) with `[@@unstable]` attributes allowing experimental APIs to be marked and gated behind `-Z` flags or local `[@@@unstable_feature]` attributes in [ocaml/ocaml#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14430)
- **Platform support** work continues with [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) activating native backend for Haiku OS in [ocaml/ocaml#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138)
- **Testsuite resilience** improvements proposed by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) in [ocaml/ocaml#14441](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14441)
- **Format_string module** proposal by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) introducing dedicated module for format string functions to reduce stdlib dependency on CamlinternalFormat in [ocaml/ocaml#12670](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12670)
- **Option.value_or** PR by [@hirrolot](https://github.com/hirrolot) remains under committee discussion with concerns about naming and API design in [ocaml/ocaml#13937](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13937)
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Single active repository**: All activity this week occurred in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with no commits in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs)
- **Four features merged**: [String.of_char](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14440), [String.is_empty](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14438), [DragonFly BSD native backend](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14431), and [testsuite not-root action](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14435)
- **Seven new PRs opened**: String module enhancements ([ocaml/ocaml#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381), [ocaml/ocaml#14436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14436), [ocaml/ocaml#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14437), [ocaml/ocaml#14439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14439)), numeric stdlib additions ([ocaml/ocaml#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433), [ocaml/ocaml#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14432)), and testsuite improvements ([ocaml/ocaml#14441](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14441))
- **Standard library modernization focus**: [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) driving systematic stdlib API expansion across String and numeric modules
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **String module API design** extensively discussed in [ocaml/ocaml#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14137) with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) proposing naming conventions using `first`, `last`, and `all` keywords for search-based operations, balancing readability with consistency across `find`, `replace`, and `split` functions
- **Unstable features mechanism** debated in [ocaml/ocaml#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14430) with [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) arguing for Rust-style unstable attributes to enable faster stdlib evolution, while [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) expressing concerns about ecosystem fragmentation and design responsibility
- **Polymorphic parameters soundness** discussed in [ocaml/ocaml#14434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14434) where [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) reported segfault with pattern matching on polymorphic parameters, with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) identifying exhaustiveness checking failure in `Parmatch`
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **String module modernization** gaining momentum with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) systematically adding search ([ocaml/ocaml#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381)), replace ([ocaml/ocaml#14436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14436)), split ([ocaml/ocaml#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14437)), empty check ([ocaml/ocaml#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14438)), affix check ([ocaml/ocaml#14439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14439)), and char conversion ([ocaml/ocaml#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14440)) functions addressing long-standing gaps in string processing
- **Stdlib API expansion** continuing with mathematical functions by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adding bit manipulation ([ocaml/ocaml#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14433)) and division operations ([ocaml/ocaml#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14432)) that match capabilities found in libraries like Zarith
- **Stdlib evolution process** under examination with proposals for unstable features in [ocaml/ocaml#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14430) and Format_string module in [ocaml/ocaml#12670](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12670) reflecting broader discussion about balancing stability with faster feature delivery
- **Platform support expansion** with DragonFly BSD ([ocaml/ocaml#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14431)) and Haiku OS ([ocaml/ocaml#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138)) native backends being enabled

group_summaries.brief_summary: Light holiday week with scheduler fairness work in Picos and API pattern discussions in Eio
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Comment formatting improvements in Picos signal handler documentation
group_summaries.new_features: - Improved **comment formatting** in `picos_mux_thread.ml` for better readability of signal handler documentation in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) ([ocaml-multicore/picos#380](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/380))
group_summaries.activity_summary: Scheduler fairness work in Picos, exception handling and fiber semantics discussions in Eio
group_summaries.activity:
- [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) opened draft PR for **fair fifo-thread scheduler** in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) implementing weakly fair scheduling using effects and system threads to prevent infinite loops from blocking other fibers ([ocaml-multicore/picos#379](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/379))
- **Multififo optimizations** draft PR opened in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) tweaking the implementation for better performance ([ocaml-multicore/picos#381](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/381))
- [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) opened issue in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) proposing `Exn.with_context` helper to reduce exception handling boilerplate ([ocaml-multicore/eio#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825)), closed after [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) explained backtrace preservation tradeoffs
- Nested `Fiber.any` race condition issue in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) reported by [Adam Cholewiński](https://github.com/adamchol) was closed ([ocaml-multicore/eio#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805)) following the merge of earlier PR that prioritizes returning fiber values over quick cancellation ([ocaml-multicore/eio#806](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/806))
- [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) commented on **io_uring security** discussion in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) about test suite compatibility issues with ZFS filesystems ([ocaml-multicore/eio#797](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/797))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Exception context helper** debate in [ocaml-multicore/eio#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825) where [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) proposed `Exn.with_context` to reduce try-catch boilerplate, and [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) explained the backtrace preservation tradeoff that makes the manual pattern necessary
- **Fiber.any cancellation** semantics clarified in [ocaml-multicore/eio#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805) where nested fiber behavior was initially unexpected by [Adam Cholewiński](https://github.com/adamchol), resolved by earlier changes in [ocaml-multicore/eio#806](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/806) that improved value return prioritization
- **Scheduler fairness** development in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with draft PR addressing fiber starvation scenarios through weakly fair scheduling ([ocaml-multicore/picos#379](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/379))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Scheduler fairness guarantees** receiving focused attention in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) with new fair fifo-thread scheduler implementation to prevent fiber starvation ([ocaml-multicore/picos#379](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/379))
- **API design discussions** in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) exploring the tradeoffs between ergonomics and runtime behavior, particularly around exception handling patterns ([ocaml-multicore/eio#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825)) and fiber cancellation semantics ([ocaml-multicore/eio#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805))
- Continued **performance tuning** of core data structures with multififo optimizations in [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos) ([ocaml-multicore/picos#381](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/381))

weekly_summary.brief_summary: Holiday week with String module expansion, jkind error fixes, Dune 3.22 released, 11 new packages added
weekly_summary.new_features_summary: String.of_char, String.is_empty, DragonFly BSD native backend, Dune 3.22 trace and cram improvements
weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **String.of_char** function converts a single character to a string with clearer intent than `String.make 1 c` in [ocaml/ocaml#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14440) by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **String.is_empty** predicate checks if a string is empty in [ocaml/ocaml#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14438) by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **DragonFly BSD native backend** enabled, making ocamlopt available on DragonFly BSD x86_64 systems in [ocaml/ocaml#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14431) by [Michael Neumann](https://github.com/mneumann)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Testsuite not-root action** allows tests to be skipped when running as superuser in [ocaml/ocaml#14435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14435) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Fixed environment scoping** in jkind error messages to ensure proper type variable printing with correct context in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5173](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5173) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Enhanced jkind printing comments** for better code clarity and maintainability in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5175](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5175) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Fixed CFG simplify terminator pass** to guard transformations that could render control flow graphs irreducible in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5174](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5174) by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Updated scannable axes documentation** with comprehensive coverage of kind system extensions in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5170](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5170) by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **Improved comment formatting** in picos_mux_thread.ml for better signal handler documentation in [ocaml-multicore/picos#380](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/380)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **New package menhir-lsp 0.1.1** providing Language Server Protocol implementation for Menhir and ocamllex with navigation and completion features in [ocaml/opam-repository#29137](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/29137)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **New package polymarket 0.1.0** providing OCaml client library for Polymarket prediction market API in [ocaml/opam-repository#29133](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/29133)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **New package shellwords 1.0.0** implementing POSIX shell command word parsing and quoting utilities in [ocaml/opam-repository#29126](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/29126)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **New package frontmatter_extractor 0.1** for extracting front-matter sections from text files in [ocaml/opam-repository#29129](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/29129)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **QCheck 0.91** released with compatibility updates across qcheck packages in [ocaml/opam-repository#29123](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/29123)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Sail 0.20.1** bugfix release with loop syntax improvements in [ocaml/opam-repository#29124](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/29124)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **MLX 0.11** updated with OCaml 5.4 support and Windows fixes in [ocaml/opam-repository#29134](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/29134)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **opam-check-npm-deps 4.1.0** now supports opam 2.5 in [ocaml/opam-repository#29131](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/29131)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Improved error handling** in ocaml.org YouTube feed scraper with exception logging in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3433)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune 3.22 released** with new `dune trace cat` subcommand for viewing trace files in [ocaml/dune#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13055), cram stanza shell customization allowing bash in [ocaml/dune#13083](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13083), structured logging implementation in [ocaml/dune#13015](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13015), and file watching events in traces in [ocaml/dune#13038](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13038)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune install path fixes** for handling relative paths outside workspace in [ocaml/dune#12993](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12993) and directory target digesting in [ocaml/dune#13045](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13045)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune platform fixes** including macOS compatibility by reverting copyfile change in [ocaml/dune#13069](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13069) and updated ocaml-lmdb fixing BSD builds in [ocaml/dune#13074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13074)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Fixed format upgrade lock handling** on Windows in opam by reusing global lock file descriptor in [ocaml/opam#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6839)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Fixed -short-paths configuration** for Merlin in ocaml-lsp by removing incorrect default in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1579](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1579)

weekly_summary.group_overview:
- __RUMINANT:core__ The **String module** received attention from [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with two merged PRs adding `String.of_char` in [ocaml/ocaml#14440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14440) and `String.is_empty` in [ocaml/ocaml#14438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14438), while seven new PRs proposed comprehensive string processing capabilities including search primitives in [ocaml/ocaml#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14381), substring replacement in [ocaml/ocaml#14436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14436), splitting in [ocaml/ocaml#14437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14437), and affix checking in [ocaml/ocaml#14439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14439)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Platform support** expanded with [Michael Neumann](https://github.com/mneumann) merging DragonFly BSD native backend in [ocaml/ocaml#14431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14431) and [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) working on Haiku OS support in [ocaml/ocaml#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14138)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Numeric module enhancements** proposed by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adding bit manipulation functions in [ocaml/ocaml#14433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14433) and division operations in [ocaml/ocaml#14432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14432)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Unstable feature annotation** mechanism proposed by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) with `[@@unstable]` attributes in [ocaml/ocaml#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14430) generating debate about ecosystem fragmentation
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Type system refinements** with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) fixing jkind error environment scoping in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5173](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5173) and improving jkind printing in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5175](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5175), while [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) fixed CFG backend issues in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5174](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5174)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **New work opened** for `or_null` type improvements by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5178) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5176), ARM64 binary emitter by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5177), and unboxed keywords by [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5167)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **Light holiday activity** with [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) opening draft PR for fair fifo-thread scheduler in [ocaml-multicore/picos#379](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/379) and API pattern discussions in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) about exception handling in [ocaml-multicore/eio#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825) and fiber semantics in [ocaml-multicore/eio#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805)

- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune 3.22 released** with [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) leading trace infrastructure modernization including new trace cat subcommand in [ocaml/dune#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13055) and csexp format migration in [ocaml/dune#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13059), while [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) completed parser generator refactoring in [ocaml/dune#13075](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13075)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Opam platform improvements** with [Benjamin Voisin](https://github.com/benjamin-voisin) working on nushell support in [ocaml/opam#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6330) and [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) developing source caching optimization in [ocaml/opam#6440](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6440)

tools: -**Dune 3.22 released** with [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) leading trace infrastructure modernization including new trace cat subcommand in [ocaml/dune#13055](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13055) and csexp format migration in [ocaml/dune#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13059), while [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) completed parser generator refactoring in [ocaml/dune#13075](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/13075)

-**Opam platform improvements** with [Benjamin Voisin](https://github.com/benjamin-voisin) working on nushell support in [ocaml/opam#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6330) and [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) developing source caching optimization in [ocaml/opam#6440](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6440)
ecosystem: -**Package ecosystem** expanded with 11 new packages merged to [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) including menhir-lsp, polymarket, shellwords, and frontmatter_extractor, with major updates to QCheck, Sail, MLX, and opam-check-npm-deps packages

-**Website stability** maintained for [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) with December 26 downtime quickly resolved by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3432) and error logging improvements in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3433)
oxcaml: -**Type system refinements** with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) fixing jkind error environment scoping in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5173](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5173) and improving jkind printing in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5175](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5175), while [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) fixed CFG backend issues in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5174](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5174)

-**New work opened** for `or_null` type improvements by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5178) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5176), ARM64 binary emitter by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5177), and unboxed keywords by [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/5167)
multicore: -**Light holiday activity** with [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) opening draft PR for fair fifo-thread scheduler in [ocaml-multicore/picos#379](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/379) and API pattern discussions in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) about exception handling in [ocaml-multicore/eio#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825) and fiber semantics in [ocaml-multicore/eio#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805)

weekly_summary.notable_discussions:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **String module API design** extensively discussed in [ocaml/ocaml#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14137) with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) proposing naming conventions using `first`, `last`, and `all` keywords for search-based operations
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Unstable features mechanism** debated in [ocaml/ocaml#14430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14430) with [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) arguing for Rust-style unstable attributes, while [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) expressed concerns about ecosystem fragmentation
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Polymorphic parameters soundness** discussed in [ocaml/ocaml#14434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14434) where [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) reported segfault with pattern matching on polymorphic parameters

tools: -**File timestamp preservation regression** in opam ≥ 2.2 discussed by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) where source files lose timestamps in [ocaml/opam#6693](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6693)
-**OCaml version conflict** reported by [@10takla](https://github.com/10takla) between ocamlformat-mlx and ocaml-lsp server in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1578](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1578)
multicore: -**Exception context helper** debate in [ocaml-multicore/eio#825](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/825) where [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) proposed `Exn.with_context` to reduce try-catch boilerplate, and [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) explained backtrace preservation tradeoffs

-**Fiber.any cancellation** semantics clarified in [ocaml-multicore/eio#805](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/805) where nested fiber behavior was initially unexpected by [Adam Cholewiński](https://github.com/adamchol)
